label: Main
info:
**Do not edit this flow.**

This is the main data processing logic for the connectors, the connector template. This flow matches the expected communication pattern of the central API. Hence, again: 

**Do not edit this flow.**

label: Specify available_datapoints
info:
This flow should be used to specify available_datapoints. This can be useful to
* Define available actuators, as these will not be detected automatically by default.
* Some logic in the flow "Receive raw_message" needs to explicitly requiest the data, e.g. by polling some API.
* If you can simply detect all available datapoints, e.g. by calling some API of the gateway.

Depending on the situation one can simply manually add the data on available datapoints to the "Manually define additional datapoint" node, or implement some more advanced logic here that does the sensing automatically.

label: Receive raw_message
Parse raw_message
Debug Dashboard
info:
This is dashboard that should help while developing or debugging the connector. 

Got to [/ui](/ui) to open it.

name: Log handler
Heartbeat
info:
This node sends a periodic heartbeat every `heartbeat_period` seconds via MQTT to the topic defined in the environment variable `MQTT_TOPIC_HEARTBEAT`. 

The `heartbeat_period` defaults to 5 seconds and can be changed as subflow property. 

The heartbeat message object looks e.g. like this:

```
"payload": {
	"this_heartbeats_timestamp": 1571927361261,
 	"next_heartbeats_timestamp": 1571927366261
}
```

name: datapoint_map receiver
Update available_datapoints
Add receival timestamp
Display the combined status of the tcp connection with the Node-RED logger and mqtt connection as subflow status.
Format log msg
func:
/*
The incomming object looks like:

topic: ""
payload: 
    level: 40
    id: "21b82c2e.44d1e4"
    type: "function"
    msg: "TEest 112233"
    _alias: "cd54c61d.3064d8"
    z: "81cb38e5.a724b8"
    timestamp: 1571843907448
ip: "::ffff:127.0.0.1"
port: 54404
_session:
    type: "tcp"
    id: "b4c68458.f1e368"
_msgid: "ef84fdce.533b1"

The outgoing msg should look like:
payload: 
    timestamp: 1571843907448
    msg: "TEest 112233"
    emitter: "cd54c61d.3064d8"
    level: 20
*/ 

// The node id of the emitting node is stored in _alias if the node is within a
// subflow. Else it's the id field
let emitter
if ('_alias' in msg.payload) {
    emitter = msg.payload._alias
} else {
    emitter = msg.payload.id
}

// Parse the log levels to Python convention
let level
switch (msg.payload.level) {
    case 10:
        level = 50
        break
    case 20:
        level = 40
        break
    case 30:
        level = 30
        break
    case 40:
        level = 20
        break
    case 50:
        level = 10
        break
    default:
        level = null
}

payload = {
    "timestamp": msg.payload.timestamp,
    "msg": msg.payload.msg,
    "emitter": emitter,
    "level": level
}

return {"payload": payload}
